description: Returns a list of thin client devices.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results that are returned per call. You can use nextToken to obtain further pages of results. This is only an upper limit. The actual number of results returned per call might be fewer than the specified maximum.

nested_items.name: serialNumber
nested_items.description: The hardware serial number of the device.

nested_items.name: model
nested_items.description: The model number of the device.

nested_items.name: environmentId
nested_items.description: The ID of the environment the device is associated with.

nested_items.name: currentSoftwareSetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the software set currently installed on the device.

nested_items.name: desiredSoftwareSetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the software set which the device has been set to.

nested_items.name: pendingSoftwareSetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the software set that is pending to be installed on the device.

nested_items.name: softwareSetUpdateSchedule
nested_items.description: An option to define if software updates should be applied within a maintenance window.

nested_items.name: lastConnectedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp of the most recent session on the device.

nested_items.name: lastPostureAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp of the most recent check-in of the device.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp of when the device was created.

nested_items.name: updatedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp of when the device was updated.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the device.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token expires after 24 hours. Using an expired pagination token will return an HTTP 400 InvalidToken error.
